snippet: More companies are turning to gamification — offering games that let their customers win points for certain activities — as a way to build both loyalty and a trove of data.
abstract: Natasha Singer Slipstream column observes that more companies are turning to gamification--offering games that let their customers win points for certain activities--as a way to build both loyalty and a trove of data; critics say the risk of gamification is that it omits the deepest elements of games, like skill and risk-taking, even as it promotes the most superficial trappings, like points, in an effort to manipulate people.
lead_paragraph: More companies are turning to gamification — offering games that let their customers win points for certain activities — as a way to build both loyalty and a trove of data.
